name: Misinformation Forensic Analysis
description: Training in forensic methodologies for detecting, analyzing, and deconstructing misinformation campaigns.

cards.title: Introduction to Misinformation Forensics
cards.description: Understanding the fundamentals of misinformation analysis and forensic methodologies.
bulletpoints: Defining misinformation, disinformation, and malinformation.
Overview of digital forensic techniques for misinformation detection.
Legal and ethical considerations in forensic analysis.
cards.summaryText: Frame threat types, outline the forensic toolkit, and stress ethical guardrails before investigations.

cards.title: Identifying Misinformation Tactics
cards.description: Recognizing key disinformation tactics used in digital and traditional media.
bulletpoints: Understanding gaslighting, fear-mongering, and narrative control.
Detecting framing techniques and loaded language.
Analyzing pattern recognition in misinformation narratives.
cards.summaryText: Spot manipulative storytelling, dissect language cues, and catalog repeated narrative patterns.

cards.title: Metadata Analysis & Digital Footprints
cards.description: Extracting and analyzing metadata to trace the origins of misinformation.
bulletpoints: Understanding EXIF metadata in images and videos.
Using OSINT tools to analyze file signatures and timestamps.
Reverse-engineering manipulated content through forensic traceability.
cards.summaryText: Pull EXIF data, corroborate timestamps with OSINT, and rebuild edit trails to expose tampering.

cards.title: Deepfake & AI-Generated Media Detection
cards.description: Techniques for identifying deepfakes, AI-generated text, and synthetic media.
bulletpoints: Recognizing inconsistencies in AI-generated video and audio.
Analyzing linguistic and grammatical patterns in synthetic text.
Using forensic software to verify media authenticity.
cards.summaryText: Scan media for deepfake artifacts, probe text cadence for synthetic tells, and confirm anomalies with forensic suites.

cards.title: Cross-Referencing Information Sources
cards.description: Validating claims by cross-referencing multiple sources for accuracy.
bulletpoints: Using structured analysis to compare sources.
Detecting patterns of synchronized misinformation distribution.
Assessing institutional credibility and media bias.
cards.summaryText: Triangulate claims across outlets, log coordinated release timing, and grade source bias.

cards.title: Bot & Sockpuppet Network Detection
cards.description: Tracking automated misinformation campaigns using AI-driven analysis.
bulletpoints: Identifying behavioral anomalies in online discussions.
Analyzing engagement spikes and automated retweet patterns.
Mapping coordinated botnet misinformation campaigns.
cards.summaryText: Flag robotic posting rhythms, track inorganic virality, and chart linked bot clusters.

cards.title: Attribution & Source Tracing
cards.description: Techniques for identifying the origins and sponsors of misinformation.
bulletpoints: Using OSINT techniques to track disinformation sources.
Tracing funding and organizational affiliations of fake news outlets.
Analyzing propaganda dissemination networks.
cards.summaryText: Layer OSINT breadcrumbs, follow money trails, and map sponsor-driven distribution trees.

cards.title: PsyOps & Psychological Warfare in Misinformation
cards.description: Analyzing the psychological impact of misinformation on targeted audiences.
bulletpoints: Recognizing cognitive biases exploited by misinformation campaigns.
Understanding narrative control techniques in mass media.
Breaking down perception manipulation tactics.
cards.summaryText: Pair exploited biases to messaging hooks, decode framing moves, and catalog emotional manipulation levers.

cards.title: Case Study Analysis: Disinformation Campaigns
cards.description: Examining real-world misinformation campaigns and their forensic breakdown.
bulletpoints: Analyzing historical disinformation operations.
Applying forensic techniques to contemporary case studies.
Developing counter-misinformation strategies based on case insights.
cards.summaryText: Review landmark campaigns, rehearse forensic playbooks on new cases, and harvest defensive lessons learned.

cards.title: Developing Counter-Disinformation Strategies
cards.description: Designing methods to neutralize and counteract misinformation campaigns.
bulletpoints: Creating rapid response mechanisms for debunking false claims.
Leveraging strategic communication to mitigate misinformation effects.
Building AI-driven misinformation detection systems.
cards.summaryText: Design fast rebuttal pipelines, craft resilient counter-messaging, and prototype detection automations.
